info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 5:29PM EDT until April 6 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Mahoning and Stark.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM EDT, the public reported continued flooding across the area, with a few road closures remaining. Steady light to moderate rain is returning to the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Youngstown, Boardman, Alliance, Louisville, Campbell, Canfield, Sebring, Minerva, Hartville, Waynesburg, Austintown, Struthers, Poland, Ellsworth, New Middletown, East Canton, Craig Beach, Lowellville, Beloit and Limaville. - At 400 PM EDT, a river gauge indicated that Sandy Creek in Waynesburg was at 7.2 feet and rising. Flood stage is 8.0 feet. The creek is expected to crest around 8.0 feet this evening before falling.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT
